com.quest.glue.api.agent
Interface Agent

public interface Agent

This interface is implemented by data collectors to receive agent life cycle commands from the agent framework.

Implementations of this interface must be listed in the manifest file, and are required to implement a constructor which takes a ServiceFactory argument.

FglAM does not make any guarantees about the thread safety of methods other than those contained in this interface. Callbacks, property change events, scheduled collections and timers can all be executed by FglAM concurrently. Agents should be developed so that they can gracefully handle these situations.

Since:
5.2.0

Method Summary
 void destroy()
          This method is invoked by the agent framework to make the implementation release any resources acquired during initialization and data collection.
 void startDataCollection()
          This method is invoked by the agent framework to make the agent start normal operation such as periodic data collection.
 void stopDataCollection()
          This method is invoked by the agent framework to make the agent stop any data collection activity and periodic tasks and return to the 'stand by' state.
 

Method Detail

destroy

void destroy()
             throws java.lang.Exception
This method is invoked by the agent framework to make the implementation release any resources acquired during initialization and data collection.

This method may take considerable time to complete, the agent framework should be prepared to deal with it.

In Management Server terminology calls to this method correspond to agent deactivation commands.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Any exception will be treated as a failure to destroy the agent

startDataCollection

void startDataCollection()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
This method is invoked by the agent framework to make the agent start normal operation such as periodic data collection.

This method may take considerable time to complete, the agent framework should be prepared to deal with it.

In Management Server terminology calls to this method correspond to "Start Data Collection" commands.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Any exception will cause data collection to be stopped

stopDataCollection

void stopDataCollection()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
This method is invoked by the agent framework to make the agent stop any data collection activity and periodic tasks and return to the 'stand by' state.

This method may take considerable time to complete, the agent framework should be prepared to deal with it.

In Management Server terminology calls to this method correspond to "Stop Data Collection" commands.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Any exception will cause the agent to be destroyed
